body:
### Problem The line-gutter's test-decorators in `:Tutor` become unresponsive after their line numbers change i.e. due to removal/addition of lines before them. while this is perfectly understandable: _of course, the test is line number specific"_ but the issue lies in the fact that the tutorial _demands_ lines to be added/deleted i.e. there's a contradiction in how the tutorial interacts with users, vs how the tests assume it would stay. ### Minimal Steps to reproduce I couldn't get the clipboard to work despite `scoop install win32yank` and restart terminal. So, some steps might feel convoluted. **Normal conditions:** 0. `nvim -c ':Tutor'` or equivalently `nvim` > `:Tutor` 1. correct the L`333` (say by, `332gg` > paste the following correct line > `jdd`) - :-) see test pass responsively **Trigger and buggy behaviour:** 2. `308gg` `dd` `332gg` or better yet, `kdd` (both are equivalent for our purpose) 3. `0i` `f` `` (make any change to try to make test fail): - :-( see that the `âœ“` stays there unresponsively **Confirmation of the diagnosis/hypothesized cause:** 4. `ki` `` `` to insert a blank line above (i.e. bring the test line number back to '333') 5. `j0a` `` `` (force refresh the test): - :-) see the test fail responsively 6. `0dw` (neutralise edits from step 5, 7): - :-) see the test pass responsively ``` Fix the errors on this line and replace them with undo. ``` ### Expected behavior the test indicator on line-gutter `âœ—âœ“` stays responsive during at least the normal flow of test... [image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/19423063/ea2d586a-0a88-4185-ad19-88555bc48373) ### Solutions? I am not sure what an ideal, MVC solution can be. Some thoughts come to mind: **update:** it seems that the best and minimum viable solution can be this 2nd one: 2. provide a quick shortcut command which restarts the test afresh from the line the user is at at the time of invocation * would require: a reminder line in tutorial text (after a deleted line) reminding user to start the test afresh - no downsides as far as i can see - full flexibility - not much is required to change, all the functionality required to make it work already exists - i.e. true to `MVC`, simple, cost effective and elegant [fold-marker]: https://neovim.io/doc/user/fold.html#fold-marker "fold-marker"
alternate solutions considered:

1. _[hash-map + array][only-upfront-cost]_ define "named chunk ranges" somehow, & refer to line numbers relative to chunk's start in tests (dictionaries can solve everything eventually ðŸ¤£) + (inspired from `powershell` config) + neo/vim already has [marker-based folding range][fold-marker] which can fit this purpose very well nevertheless, it seems non-trivial to use that in this way + but once done; the rest will be easy ride + full flexibility of attempting tests in any order + no constraints on what is done to lines outside of the test chunk: i.e. full freedom to experiment _and_ edit + no need to make sweeping changes to fix the line locations in tests on any line insertions in the tutor ^ 0. _[brute-force][continous-cost]_ hard-coding the expected line numbers after the line deletions through test - _requires alll the tests_ and _nothing except the tests_ to be done _sequentially_ - i.e. would also require to save the tutorial buffer, and resume from there the next time - overall, toooo much restrictive

Sample from neo/vim's marker based folding range with `{{{ ... }}}`: ```markdown ``` Sample from powershell's named chunks with `#region ... #endregion` : ```powershell #region conda initialize # !! Contents within this block are managed by 'conda init' !! If (Test-Path "...\mambaforge\Scripts\conda.exe") { (& "...\mambaforge\Scripts\conda.exe" "shell.powershell" "hook") | Out-String | ?{$_} | Invoke-Expression } #endregion ```

Environment

### Neovim version (nvim -v) NVIM v0.9.5 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1710088188 system vimrc file: "$VIM\sysinit.vim" fall-back for $VIM: "/mingw64/share/nvim" Run :checkhealth for more info ### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same? not applicable ### Operating system/version windows 10.0.19045 N/A Build 19045 ### Terminal name/version mintty 3.7.1 (x86_64-pc-msys) ### $TERM environment variable xterm ### Installation in msys2 `mingw-w64-x86_64-neovim` pkg via command: `pacboy -S neovim:x`

### Additional context

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor.json#L11-L26

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L333

* 2.6 OPERATING ON LINES
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9af355964306977eab836ca5324ed70d685c0c8e/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L292-L294

* 5.4 RETRIEVING AND MERGING FILES
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9af355964306977eab836ca5324ed70d685c0c8e/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L685-L689

* 6.1 THE OPEN COMMAND

_self hiding as resolved/offtopic_ ---- _update 2024.05.11:_ in the `init.lua`, do: `vim.o.number = true` to enable absolute number also just noticed that absolute line number is not shown at current line. (i.e. it is saying `0` instead of the actual number) i turned it on via: `:setglobal relativenumber`

_self hiding as resolved:_ as the outcome of this thoughtline has been confirmed and added in the description above ---- it should not have been the case though... i am guessing that something is going on with me making edits. probably line ending problem due to it being on msys2 (linux like environment) but input via windows? idk.
Details

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor.json#L21 https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor.json#L26-L31 https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L333 https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L398-L399 https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L419-L420

there's nothing special in tests which are behaving expectedly either:
Details

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor.json#L9-L11 https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L216 https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor#L232

---- oh wait, might it be that: 3. since there have been several `dd`'s before that? can that be interfering with it somehow? i just did `333gg` (go to L333: " Fiix the errors oon thhis li...") `I` (insert before), and the test indication decorator in line gutter disappeared for that line ðŸ˜… 4. **update:** or even better, it seems that all the tests from start are passing, then on the first `-1` as value (in tutor.json), all the tests thereafter are failing? i stumbled on this thought from the initial hunch that: 1. maybe some previous test is failing, due to which are subsequent tests are failing as well. 2. then i noticed that they are `-1`, which might mean they are to be removed, or they are okay, or do not matter https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1b55ed58ecaba96f91a21685b7019362320ea156/runtime/tutor/en/vim-01-beginner.tutor.json#L11-L31 ---- ~_self hiding as duplicate_ and copying/moving to comment above~ oh wait, might it be that since there have been several `dd`'s before that? can that be interfering with it somehow? i stumbled on this thought from the initial hunch that maybe some previous test is failing, due to which are subsequent tests are failing as well.

hi @ justinmk 

is it possible to reload/revert the tutor?

following this: [edit-a-file], i tried doing `:e!` inside the `:Tutor`, and it showed me blank.
i am positive that reloading tutor is the sure-fire and minimum way to solve this issue.

i even tried rerunning `:Tutor` inside `:Tutor`, but again showed me blank.

do you have any other thoughts?

[edit-a-file]: https://neovim.io/doc/user/editing.html#edit-a-file
[restore]: https://neovim.io/doc/user/tips.html#restore-position

Can you try the development version? 

- The [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page has pre-built archives for Linux/Windows/macOS. 
- Check `:version` to confirm that you are using the latest version.

_self hiding as outdated_

---
hi!

> * Check `:version` to confirm that you are using the latest version.

yeah, it is the latest version. ðŸ˜ƒ 
as for the development one, it seems to be not available in `scoop`. i will write manifest file for it (based on neovim stable's manifest) and then only can try it

but i haven't ever done that before. so, it may take a while.

```
:version
NVIM v0.9.5
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1710088188

   system vimrc file: "$VIM\sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/mingw64/share/nvim"

Run :checkhealth for more info

```

> , it seems to be not available in `scoop`.

don't need scoop, download it from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly

_self hiding as resolved (probably)_ ---- i changed the following things (see [manifest-ref] / `autoupdate`, `checkver`, `bin`, `shortcuts`) [create-manifest]: https://github.com/ScoopInstaller/Scoop/wiki/Creating-an-app-manifest "creating-manifest" [manifest-ref]: https://github.com/ScoopInstaller/Scoop/wiki/App-Manifests "App Manifests reference" ```jq # file: changed_elements.jq { bin, shortcuts, # Remove as the nightly doesn't seem to have 'bin\nvim-qt.exe' urls: { architecture_url:.architecture."64bit".url, checkver_url:.checkver.url, autoupdate_url:.autoupdate.architecture."64bit".url } } ``` and updated the rest (hash, version etc) automatically by `scoop/.../check*` scripts with `-up` option (exception: `checkurls.ps1`) Indicatively: `powershell -F .../check{urls,ver,hashes}.ps1 neovim.dev . [-Update]` ```console $ declare spf=".../scoop/apps/scoop/current/bin" $ echo -n check{urls,ver,hashes}.ps1 | xargs -ti -d' ' powershell -F $spf/{} neovim-dev . [U]RLs | [O]kay | | [F]ailed | | | [1][1][0] neovim-dev neovim-dev: 0.10.0-dev-2801 nvim-win64.zip (16.6 MB) [========] 100% neovim-dev: OK $ scoop install neovim-dev.json Creating shim for 'nvim-dev'. 'neovim-dev' (0.10.0-dev-2801) was installed successfully! 'neovim-dev' suggests installing 'extras/vcredist2022'. ``` ----
Details

```console $ cat neovim-dev.json | jq -f changed_elements.jq { "bin": [ [ "bin\\nvim.exe", "nvim-dev" ] ], "shortcuts": null, "urls": { "architecture_url": "https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim-win64.zip", "checkver_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/neovim/neovim/releases/tags/nightly", "autoupdate_url": "https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim-win64.zip" } } ``` ```console $ scoop cat neovim | diff - neovim-dev.json ``` ```diff 2c2 < "version": "0.9.5", --- > "version": "0.10.0-dev-2801", 14,15c14,15 < "url": "https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/v0.9.5/nvim-win64.zip", < "hash": "de6dc1f0edb45f5f225ee24ce80a4fcbc3a337932037e98ae143975fca2556bf" --- > "url": "https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim-win64.zip", > "hash": "ac4fe62cfd1c1763929c66bc822f4b94b97da36c18862f41e7bd90569f2638d3" 20,27c20 < "bin\\nvim.exe", < "bin\\nvim-qt.exe" < ], < "shortcuts": [ < [ < "bin\\nvim-qt.exe", < "Neovim" < ] --- > [ "bin\\nvim.exe", "nvim-dev" ] 30c23 < "url": "https://api.github.com/repositories/16408992/releases/latest", --- > "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/neovim/neovim/releases/tags/nightly", 38c31 < "url": "https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/v$version/nvim-win64.zip" --- > "url": "https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim-win64.zip" ```

> don't need scoop

sure it doesn't; but scoop makes things easy to manage. 
i have already faced enough headache with manually managing installs of various things over last couple of yrs.

```
:version
NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2801+g75b80516d
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1710088188
Run ":verbose version" for more info

```

error is reproduced on latest nightly
This is way too much complication for what appears to be a small problem. Either send a PR that fixes it or it's wontfix.

the question is simple, can tutor be reloaded or not.
and u still didn't address it ðŸ˜ž
